item.description:
Release date: 2026-01-14

What's New

  • **Local model downloads in Settings** – Local Providers now list recommended Ollama and LM Studio models with hardware guidance and quick download or copy actions.

Improvements

  • **More reliable local model output** – Local prompts now enforce template rules so assembled filenames match transformed fields, and JSON/fenced responses are cleaned automatically.
  • **Cleaner freeform naming on local providers** – Ollama and LM Studio freeform authoring now uses chat endpoints for more consistent responses.
  • **Suffixes now stick with dot separators.** Smart Rename no longer drops suffix text when you use `.` as the separator.
  • **Smart Rename affixes are now global-only.** Any legacy per-folder prefix/suffix overrides are cleared on upgrade.

Release date: 2025-12-24

Completely Redesigned Settings

Settings has been rebuilt from the ground up with native macOS styling. The new design features a clean sidebar with six organized categories—General, Appearance, Notifications, AI, Processing, and About—making it faster to find what you need.

**What's new:**

  • **Instant Search** – Press ⌘F to search across all settings. Select a result to jump directly to that setting, highlighted and ready to adjust.
  • **Keyboard Navigation** – Use ⌘1 through ⌘6 to jump to any category instantly.
  • **Refreshed AI Provider Cards** – Each provider displays its official logo with clear connection status indicators.

Also in This Update

  • **More List Columns** – Six new column options: Last Viewed, Created Date, Modified Date, File Size, Tags, and Comments. Choose up to 3 to display.
  • **API Key Validation Now Tests Real Connectivity** – When you enter an API key for OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini, or Ollama, NameQuick now verifies it actually works by making a test connection. You'll see clear status indicators showing whether your key is valid, invalid, or if the service is temporarily unavailable.

Release date: 2025-12-18

What's New

  • **Try NameQuick Free with Your Own API Key** – New users can now try NameQuick free for 14 days using their own OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini, or Ollama API key. The trial includes a set number of AI-powered renames to help you evaluate the app before committing.
  • **Subscription Trials for New Customers** – If you prefer not to use your own API key, you can now start a free trial of our managed AI service. Existing customers returning after a break will see a welcome-back flow that recognizes their account.

Improvements

  • **Faster, More Memory-Efficient Image Processing** – Renamed files containing images now process more efficiently with lower memory usage. Large batches of screenshots and photos should no longer cause slowdowns or high memory consumption.
  • **More Reliable Gemini Integration** – Files that Gemini cannot process (due to content restrictions) now display a clear error message instead of retrying silently. Credits are only charged when a rename actually succeeds.

Fixes

  • Fixed an issue where upgrading from a trial to a subscription didn't immediately reflect in the app, showing stale "trial" indicators until restart.
  • Fixed an issue where purchased BYOK (Bring Your Own Key) licenses were incorrectly shown trial-related UI elements.
  • Trial periods now use server-verified time to ensure accurate expiration regardless of system clock settings.
  • Fixed unnecessary complexity in AI responses by only including the internal rule log field when templates actually use transformation rules.
  • Fixed a template bug where previously working templates broke. These should be stable now.

Release date: 2025-11-29

  • Another small bug fix for subscription users.

# NameQuick 2.0.46

Release date: 2025-11-29

  • Small bug fix for subscription users.

# NameQuick 2.0.45

  • Fixed a license logging crash when disk space is low by serializing writes on an actor and gating the HUD to foreground state.
